trans-unit.source: Power BI dashboard on Stream Analytics | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Power BI dashboard on Stream Analytics | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Use a real-time streaming Power BI dashboard to gather business intelligence and analyze high-volume data from a Stream Analytics job.
trans-unit.target: Use a real-time streaming Power BI dashboard to gather business intelligence and analyze high-volume data from a Stream Analytics job.

trans-unit.source: Azure Stream Analytics & Power BI: Live dashboard for analytics in real-time on streaming data
trans-unit.target: Azure Stream Analytics & Power BI: Live dashboard for analytics in real-time on streaming data

trans-unit.source: Azure Stream Analytics allows you to take advantage of one of the leading business intelligence tools, Microsoft Power BI.
trans-unit.target: Azure Stream Analytics allows you to take advantage of one of the leading business intelligence tools, Microsoft Power BI.

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Azure Stream Analytics to analyze high-volume, streaming data and get the insight in a real-time Power BI dashboard.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Azure Stream Analytics to analyze high-volume, streaming data and get the insight in a real-time Power BI dashboard.

trans-unit.source: Use [Microsoft Power BI](https://powerbi.com/) to build a live dashboard quickly.
trans-unit.target: Use [Microsoft Power BI](https://powerbi.com/) to build a live dashboard quickly.

trans-unit.source: [Watch a video illustrating the scenario](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SGUpT-a99MA).
trans-unit.target: [Watch a video illustrating the scenario](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SGUpT-a99MA).

trans-unit.source: In this article, learn how create your own custom business intelligence tools by using Power BI as an output for your Azure Stream Analytics jobs.
trans-unit.target: In this article, learn how create your own custom business intelligence tools by using Power BI as an output for your Azure Stream Analytics jobs.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Power BI output is a preview feature of Azure Stream Analytics.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Power BI output is a preview feature of Azure Stream Analytics.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure Account
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure Account

trans-unit.source: An input for the Stream Analytics job to consume streaming data from.
trans-unit.target: An input for the Stream Analytics job to consume streaming data from.

trans-unit.source: Stream Analytics accepts input from Azure Event Hubs or Azure Blob storage.
trans-unit.target: Stream Analytics accepts input from Azure Event Hubs or Azure Blob storage.

trans-unit.source: Work or school account for Power BI
trans-unit.target: Work or school account for Power BI

trans-unit.source: Create Azure Stream Analytics Job
trans-unit.target: Create Azure Stream Analytics Job

trans-unit.source: From [Azure Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com), click **New, Data Services, Stream Analytics, Quick Create**.
trans-unit.target: From [Azure Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com), click **New, Data Services, Stream Analytics, Quick Create**.

trans-unit.source: Specifiy the following values, then click **Create Stream Analytics job**:
trans-unit.target: Specifiy the following values, then click **Create Stream Analytics job**:

trans-unit.source: **Job Name** - Enter a job name.
trans-unit.target: **Job Name** - Enter a job name.

trans-unit.source: For example, **DeviceTemperatures**.
trans-unit.target: For example, **DeviceTemperatures**.

trans-unit.source: **Region** - Select the region where you want the job located.
trans-unit.target: **Region** - Select the region where you want the job located.

trans-unit.source: Consider placing the job and the event hub in the same region to ensure optimal performance and avoid incurring data transfer costs between regions.
trans-unit.target: Consider placing the job and the event hub in the same region to ensure optimal performance and avoid incurring data transfer costs between regions.

trans-unit.source: **Storage Account** - Choose the Storage Account that you would like to use to store monitoring data for all Stream Analytics jobs running within this region.
trans-unit.target: **Storage Account** - Choose the Storage Account that you would like to use to store monitoring data for all Stream Analytics jobs running within this region.

trans-unit.source: You have the option to choose an existing Storage Account or create a new one.
trans-unit.target: You have the option to choose an existing Storage Account or create a new one.

trans-unit.source: Click **Stream Analytics** in the left pane to list the Stream Analytics jobs.
trans-unit.target: Click **Stream Analytics** in the left pane to list the Stream Analytics jobs.

trans-unit.source: graphic1
trans-unit.target: graphic1

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.TIP] The new job will be listed with a status of **Not Started**.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.TIP] The new job will be listed with a status of **Not Started**.

trans-unit.source: Notice that the **Start** button on the bottom of the page is disabled.
trans-unit.target: Notice that the **Start** button on the bottom of the page is disabled.

trans-unit.source: This is expected behavior as you must configure the job input, output, query, and so on before you can start the job.
trans-unit.target: This is expected behavior as you must configure the job input, output, query, and so on before you can start the job.

trans-unit.source: Specify job input
trans-unit.target: Specify job input

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, we are assuming you are using Event Hub as an input with JSON serialization and UTF-8 encoding.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, we are assuming you are using Event Hub as an input with JSON serialization and UTF-8 encoding.

trans-unit.source: Click the job name.
trans-unit.target: Click the job name.

trans-unit.source: Click **Inputs** from the top of the page, and then click **Add Input**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Inputs** from the top of the page, and then click **Add Input**.

trans-unit.source: The dialog that opens will walk you through a number of steps to set up your input.
trans-unit.target: The dialog that opens will walk you through a number of steps to set up your input.

trans-unit.source: Select **Data Stream**, and then click the right button.
trans-unit.target: Select **Data Stream**, and then click the right button.

trans-unit.source: Select **Event Hub**, and then click the right button.
trans-unit.target: Select **Event Hub**, and then click the right button.

trans-unit.source: Type or select the following values on the third page:
trans-unit.target: Type or select the following values on the third page:

trans-unit.source: **Input Alias** - Enter a friendly name for this job input.
trans-unit.target: **Input Alias** - Enter a friendly name for this job input.

trans-unit.source: Note that you will be using this name in the query later on.
trans-unit.target: Note that you will be using this name in the query later on.

trans-unit.source: **Event Hub** - If the Event Hub you created is in the same subscription as the Stream Analytics job, select the namespace that the event hub is in.
trans-unit.target: **Event Hub** - If the Event Hub you created is in the same subscription as the Stream Analytics job, select the namespace that the event hub is in.

trans-unit.source: If your event hub is in a different subscription, select **Use Event Hub from Another Subscription** and manually enter information for **Service Bus Namespace**, **Event Hub Name**, **Event Hub Policy Name**, **Event Hub Policy Key**, and **Event Hub Partition Count**.
trans-unit.target: If your event hub is in a different subscription, select **Use Event Hub from Another Subscription** and manually enter information for **Service Bus Namespace**, **Event Hub Name**, **Event Hub Policy Name**, **Event Hub Policy Key**, and **Event Hub Partition Count**.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] This sample uses the default number of partitions, which is 16.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] This sample uses the default number of partitions, which is 16.

trans-unit.source: **Event Hub Name** - Select the name of the Azure Event Hub you have.
trans-unit.target: **Event Hub Name** - Select the name of the Azure Event Hub you have.

trans-unit.source: **Event Hub Policy Name** - Select the Event Hub policy for the Event Hub you are using.
trans-unit.target: **Event Hub Policy Name** - Select the Event Hub policy for the Event Hub you are using.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that this policy has manage permissions.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that this policy has manage permissions.

trans-unit.source: **Event Hub Consumer Group** – You can leave this empty or specify a consumer group you have on your Event Hub.
trans-unit.target: **Event Hub Consumer Group** – You can leave this empty or specify a consumer group you have on your Event Hub.

trans-unit.source: Note that each consumer group of an Event Hub can have only 5 readers at a time.
trans-unit.target: Note that each consumer group of an Event Hub can have only 5 readers at a time.

trans-unit.source: So, decide the right consumer group for your job accordingly.
trans-unit.target: So, decide the right consumer group for your job accordingly.

trans-unit.source: If you leave the field blank, it will use the default consumer group.
trans-unit.target: If you leave the field blank, it will use the default consumer group.

trans-unit.source: Click the right button.
trans-unit.target: Click the right button.

trans-unit.source: Specify the following values:
trans-unit.target: Specify the following values:

trans-unit.source: **Event Serializer Format** - JSON
trans-unit.target: **Event Serializer Format** - JSON

trans-unit.source: **Encoding** - UTF8
trans-unit.target: **Encoding** - UTF8

trans-unit.source: Click the check button to add this source and to verify that Stream Analytics can successfully connect to the Event Hub.
trans-unit.target: Click the check button to add this source and to verify that Stream Analytics can successfully connect to the Event Hub.

trans-unit.source: Add Power BI output
trans-unit.target: Add Power BI output

trans-unit.source: Click **Output** from the top of the page, and then click **Add Output**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Output** from the top of the page, and then click **Add Output**.

trans-unit.source: You will see Power BI listed as an output option.
trans-unit.target: You will see Power BI listed as an output option.

trans-unit.source: graphic2
trans-unit.target: graphic2

trans-unit.source: Select **Power BI** and then click the right button.
trans-unit.target: Select **Power BI** and then click the right button.

trans-unit.source: You will see a screen like the following:
trans-unit.target: You will see a screen like the following:

trans-unit.source: graphic3
trans-unit.target: graphic3

trans-unit.source: In this step, supply a work or school account for the Stream Analytics job output.
trans-unit.target: In this step, supply a work or school account for the Stream Analytics job output.

trans-unit.source: If you already have Power BI account, select **Authorize Now**.
trans-unit.target: If you already have Power BI account, select **Authorize Now**.

trans-unit.source: If not, choose **Sign up now**.
trans-unit.target: If not, choose **Sign up now**.

trans-unit.source: [Here is a good blog walking through details of Power BI sign up](http://blogs.technet.com/b/powerbisupport/archive/2015/02/06/power-bi-sign-up-walkthrough.aspx).
trans-unit.target: [Here is a good blog walking through details of Power BI sign up](http://blogs.technet.com/b/powerbisupport/archive/2015/02/06/power-bi-sign-up-walkthrough.aspx).

trans-unit.source: graphic11
trans-unit.target: graphic11

trans-unit.source: Next you will see a screen like the following:
trans-unit.target: Next you will see a screen like the following:

trans-unit.source: graphic4
trans-unit.target: graphic4

trans-unit.source: Provide values as below:
trans-unit.target: Provide values as below:

trans-unit.source: **Output Alias** – You can put any output alias that is easy for you to refer to.
trans-unit.target: **Output Alias** – You can put any output alias that is easy for you to refer to.

trans-unit.source: This output alias is particularly helpful if you decide to have multiple outputs for your job.
trans-unit.target: This output alias is particularly helpful if you decide to have multiple outputs for your job.

trans-unit.source: In that case, you have to refer to this output in your query.
trans-unit.target: In that case, you have to refer to this output in your query.

trans-unit.source: For example, let’s use the output alias value = “OutPbi”.
trans-unit.target: For example, let’s use the output alias value = “OutPbi”.

trans-unit.source: **Dataset Name** - Provide a dataset name that you want your Power BI output to have.
trans-unit.target: **Dataset Name** - Provide a dataset name that you want your Power BI output to have.

trans-unit.source: For example, let’s use “pbidemo”.
trans-unit.target: For example, let’s use “pbidemo”.

trans-unit.source: **Table Name** - Provide a table name under the dataset of your Power BI output.
trans-unit.target: **Table Name** - Provide a table name under the dataset of your Power BI output.

trans-unit.source: Let’s say we call it “pbidemo”.
trans-unit.target: Let’s say we call it “pbidemo”.

trans-unit.source: Currently, Power BI output from Stream Analytics jobs may only have one table in a dataset.
trans-unit.target: Currently, Power BI output from Stream Analytics jobs may only have one table in a dataset.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] You should not explicitly create this dataset and table in your Power BI account.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] You should not explicitly create this dataset and table in your Power BI account.

trans-unit.source: They will be automatically created when you start your Stream Analytics job and the job starts pumping output into Power BI.
trans-unit.target: They will be automatically created when you start your Stream Analytics job and the job starts pumping output into Power BI.

trans-unit.source: If your job query doesn’t return any results, the dataset and table will not be created.
trans-unit.target: If your job query doesn’t return any results, the dataset and table will not be created.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK**, **Test Connection** and now you output configuraiton is complete.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK**, **Test Connection** and now you output configuraiton is complete.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.WARNING] Also be aware that if Power BI already had a dataset and table with the same name as the one you provided in this Stream Analytics job, the existing data will be overwritten.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.WARNING] Also be aware that if Power BI already had a dataset and table with the same name as the one you provided in this Stream Analytics job, the existing data will be overwritten.

trans-unit.source: Write Query
trans-unit.target: Write Query

trans-unit.source: Go to the **Query** tab of your job.
trans-unit.target: Go to the **Query** tab of your job.

trans-unit.source: Write your query, the output of which you want in your Power BI.
trans-unit.target: Write your query, the output of which you want in your Power BI.

trans-unit.source: For example, it could be something such as the following SQL query:
trans-unit.target: For example, it could be something such as the following SQL query:

trans-unit.source: Start your job.
trans-unit.target: Start your job.

trans-unit.source: Validate that your event hub is receiving events and your query generates the expected results.
trans-unit.target: Validate that your event hub is receiving events and your query generates the expected results.

trans-unit.source: If your query outputs 0 rows, Power BI dataset and tables will not be automatically created.
trans-unit.target: If your query outputs 0 rows, Power BI dataset and tables will not be automatically created.

trans-unit.source: Create the Dashboard in Power BI
trans-unit.target: Create the Dashboard in Power BI

trans-unit.source: Go to [Powerbi.com](https://powerbi.com) and login with your work or school account.
trans-unit.target: Go to [Powerbi.com](https://powerbi.com) and login with your work or school account.

trans-unit.source: If the Stream Analytics job query outputs results, you will see your dataset is already created:
trans-unit.target: If the Stream Analytics job query outputs results, you will see your dataset is already created:

trans-unit.source: graphic5
trans-unit.target: graphic5

trans-unit.source: For creating the dashboard, go to the Dashboards option and create a new Dashboard.
trans-unit.target: For creating the dashboard, go to the Dashboards option and create a new Dashboard.

trans-unit.source: graphic6
trans-unit.target: graphic6

trans-unit.source: In this example we'll lable it "Demo Dashboard".
trans-unit.target: In this example we'll lable it "Demo Dashboard".

trans-unit.source: Now click on the dataset created by your Stream Analytics job (pbidemo in our current example).
trans-unit.target: Now click on the dataset created by your Stream Analytics job (pbidemo in our current example).

trans-unit.source: You will be taken to a page to create a chart on top of this dataset.
trans-unit.target: You will be taken to a page to create a chart on top of this dataset.

trans-unit.source: The following is but one example of the reports you can create:
trans-unit.target: The following is but one example of the reports you can create:

trans-unit.source: Select Σ temp and time fields.
trans-unit.target: Select Σ temp and time fields.

trans-unit.source: They will automatically go to Value and Axis for the chart:
trans-unit.target: They will automatically go to Value and Axis for the chart:

trans-unit.source: graphic7
trans-unit.target: graphic7

trans-unit.source: With this, you will automatically get a chart as below:
trans-unit.target: With this, you will automatically get a chart as below:

trans-unit.source: graphic8
trans-unit.target: graphic8

trans-unit.source: In the value section, click on the drop down for temp and choose **average** for the temperature and on the chart, click on **visualization** and choose **line chart**:
trans-unit.target: In the value section, click on the drop down for temp and choose **average** for the temperature and on the chart, click on **visualization** and choose **line chart**:

trans-unit.source: graphic9
trans-unit.target: graphic9

trans-unit.source: You will now get a line chart of average over time.
trans-unit.target: You will now get a line chart of average over time.

trans-unit.source: Using the pin option as below, you can pin this to your dashboard that you previously created:
trans-unit.target: Using the pin option as below, you can pin this to your dashboard that you previously created:

trans-unit.source: graphic10
trans-unit.target: graphic10

trans-unit.source: Now when you view the dashboard with this pinned report, you will see report updating in real time.
trans-unit.target: Now when you view the dashboard with this pinned report, you will see report updating in real time.

trans-unit.source: Try changing the data in your events – spike temp or something like that and you will see the real-time effect of that reflected in your dashboard.
trans-unit.target: Try changing the data in your events – spike temp or something like that and you will see the real-time effect of that reflected in your dashboard.

trans-unit.source: Note that this tutorial demonstrated how to create but one kind of chart for a dataset.
trans-unit.target: Note that this tutorial demonstrated how to create but one kind of chart for a dataset.

trans-unit.source: Power BI can help you create other customer business intelligence tools for your organization.
trans-unit.target: Power BI can help you create other customer business intelligence tools for your organization.

trans-unit.source: For another example of a Power BI dashboard, watch the [Getting Started with Power BI](https://youtu.be/L-Z_6P56aas?t=1m58s) video.
trans-unit.target: For another example of a Power BI dashboard, watch the [Getting Started with Power BI](https://youtu.be/L-Z_6P56aas?t=1m58s) video.

trans-unit.source: Another helpful resource to learn more about creating Dashboards with Power BI is [Dashboards in Power BI Preview](http://support.powerbi.com/knowledgebase/articles/424868-dashboards-in-power-bi-preview).
trans-unit.target: Another helpful resource to learn more about creating Dashboards with Power BI is [Dashboards in Power BI Preview](http://support.powerbi.com/knowledgebase/articles/424868-dashboards-in-power-bi-preview).

trans-unit.source: Limitations and best practices
trans-unit.target: Limitations and best practices

trans-unit.source: Power BI employs both concurrency and throughput constraints as described here: [https://powerbi.microsoft.com/pricing](https://powerbi.microsoft.com/pricing "Power BI Pricing")
trans-unit.target: Power BI employs both concurrency and throughput constraints as described here: [https://powerbi.microsoft.com/pricing](https://powerbi.microsoft.com/pricing "Power BI Pricing")

trans-unit.source: Because of those Power BI lands itself most naturally to cases where Azure Stream Analytics does a significant data load reduction.
trans-unit.target: Because of those Power BI lands itself most naturally to cases where Azure Stream Analytics does a significant data load reduction.

trans-unit.source: We recommend using TumblingWindow or HoppingWindow to ensure that data push would be at most 1 push/second and that your query lands within the throughput requirements – you can use the following equation to compute the value to give your window in seconds:
trans-unit.target: We recommend using TumblingWindow or HoppingWindow to ensure that data push would be at most 1 push/second and that your query lands within the throughput requirements – you can use the following equation to compute the value to give your window in seconds:

trans-unit.source: equation1
trans-unit.target: equation1

trans-unit.source: As an example – If you have 1,000 devices sending data every second, you are on the Power BI Pro SKU that supports 1,000,000 rows/hour and you want to get average data per device on Power BI you can do at most a push every 4 seconds per device (as shown below):
trans-unit.target: As an example – If you have 1,000 devices sending data every second, you are on the Power BI Pro SKU that supports 1,000,000 rows/hour and you want to get average data per device on Power BI you can do at most a push every 4 seconds per device (as shown below):

trans-unit.source: equation2
trans-unit.target: equation2

trans-unit.source: Which means we would change the original query to:
trans-unit.target: Which means we would change the original query to:

trans-unit.source: Renew Authorization
trans-unit.target: Renew Authorization

trans-unit.source: There is a temporary limitation where the authentication token needs to be manually refreshed every 90 days for all jobs with Power BI output.
trans-unit.target: There is a temporary limitation where the authentication token needs to be manually refreshed every 90 days for all jobs with Power BI output.

trans-unit.source: You will also need to re-authenticate your Power BI account if its password has changed since your job was created or last authenticated.
trans-unit.target: You will also need to re-authenticate your Power BI account if its password has changed since your job was created or last authenticated.

trans-unit.source: A symptom of this issue is no job output and an "Authenticate user error" in the Operations Logs:
trans-unit.target: A symptom of this issue is no job output and an "Authenticate user error" in the Operations Logs:

trans-unit.source: graphic12
trans-unit.target: graphic12

trans-unit.source: To resolve this issue, stop your running job and go to your Power BI output.
trans-unit.target: To resolve this issue, stop your running job and go to your Power BI output.

trans-unit.source: Click the “Renew authorization” link, and restart your job from the Last Stopped Time to avoid data loss.
trans-unit.target: Click the “Renew authorization” link, and restart your job from the Last Stopped Time to avoid data loss.

trans-unit.source: graphic13
trans-unit.target: graphic13

trans-unit.source: Get help
trans-unit.target: Get help

trans-unit.source: For further assistance, try our [Azure Stream Analytics forum](https://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/en-US/home?forum=AzureStreamAnalytics)
trans-unit.target: For further assistance, try our [Azure Stream Analytics forum](https://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/en-US/home?forum=AzureStreamAnalytics)
